issues.description: The UML diagram in the problem statement shows the Farm classâ€™s animals attribute as a List<Animal>, but the text in Part 3 explicitly instructs students to use a Set<Animal> (HashSet) to ensure uniqueness. This contradiction will confuse students about which collection type to implement.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the UML diagram to declare animals as a Set<Animal> (using a HashSet) so it matches the textual instructions in Part 3.

issues.description: In the reference solution, Farm.java defines the animals field as a List<Animal> and initializes it with an ArrayList, but the exercise specification requires a Set<Animal> (HashSet) to avoid duplicate animals.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the animals field type to Set<Animal>, initialize it with a new HashSet<>(), and update the getter, setter, and addAnimal method to use Set.
